title: Wildfire scorches historic California gold mining town
description: A wildfire scorched thousands of acres and burned homes in Chinese Camp Town, a California Gold Rush town settled around 1850 by miners from China. CalFire said the blaze was started by lightning and was just one of more than a dozen wildfires that ignited across California on Tuesday.
content:
A wildfire scorched thousands of acres and burned homes in Chinese Camp, a California Gold Rush town settled around 1850 by miners from China. CalFire said the blaze was started by lightning and was just one of more than a dozen wildfires that ignited across California on Tuesday.

Along with the excitement that accompanies the start of school, parents and schoolchildren in Washington, DC, have something new to contend with this year: how to navigate a federal law enforcement surge and immigration crackdown in the nation’s capital. CNN'S Sunlen Serfaty reports from CommuniKids, a language immersion preschool in D.C. and Virginia.

A Houston man is accused of killing an 11-year-old boy after a “ding dong ditch” prank – the latest example of a trend that has left children dead. Gonzalo Leon Jr., 42, was charged with murder for the death of 11-year-old Julián Guzman, the city of Houston. Leon made an initial court appearance Tuesday and agreed to have a court-appointed attorney.

The United States conducted a deadly military strike against an alleged drug boat tied to the cartel Tren de Aragua, President Donald Trump. The president said 11 people were killed in the strike in “international waters.” Secretary of State Marco Rubio described the “lethal strike” as taking place in the “southern Caribbean” against “a drug vessel which had departed from Venezuela.”

Chicago resident says deploying the National Guard would be a ‘band-aid’ Chicago resident Rochelle Sykes says deploying the National Guard would only be a band-aid and not a solution to the violence that has plagued the city. She chats with CNN's Omar Jimenez about what she thinks needs to be done. Chicago resident says deploying the National Guard would be a ‘band-aid’

Trump to award Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom President Donald Trump announced on Monday that he will award former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the highest civilian honor. Trump to award Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom

Rear axle flies off stolen car trying to flee police Police released dash-cam video of a driver fleeing in a stolen car in Michigan. Police used a Grapple device as the driver tried to get away, ripping the axel from the car. Three were arrested with no injuries. Rear axle flies off stolen car trying to flee police

Man found dead in pool of blood at Burning Man A man found dead in a pool of blood is being investigated as a homicide at the annual Burning Man festival in the northwestern Nevada desert, according to the Pershing County Sheriff’s Office. The sheriff's office has yet to identify the man and no other information was released. Man found dead in pool of blood at Burning Man

Border Patrol agents arrested two firefighters on Wednesday, who they say were in the United States illegally, while they were working to contain Washington state’s biggest wildfire. CNN's Priscilla Alvarez reports.

keywords.name: former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani

summary: A wildfire has scorched thousands of acres and burned homes in Chinese Camp, a California Gold Rush town settled around 1850 by miners from China. A Houston man is accused of murdering an 11-year-old boy after a "dance-dance" prank, the latest example of a trend that has left children dead. The United States conducted a deadly military strike against an alleged drug boat tied to the cartel Tren de Aragua, killing 11 people. President Donald Trump announced on Monday that he would award former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the highest civilian honor. Chicago resident Rochelle Sykes said deploying the National Guard would only be a band-aid and not a solution to the violence that has plagued the city.
shortSummary: A California wildfire destroyed historic Gold Camp homes, while a deadly military strike against a drug boat in international waters raised concerns in Washington.

argos_summary: A lightning‑ignited wildfire scorched thousands of acres and destroyed homes in Chinese Camp, a historic California Gold Rush town. The blaze was one of more than a dozen fires that erupted across the state on Tuesday, according to CalFire.
